summary: This document is a chain of emails from late June/early July 2020 regarding travel approval for an FBI/NYPD task force operation to arrest a target in the Epstein investigation believed to be in Massachusetts. The emails detail expense estimates and approvals for a four-person team.

persons.name: Detective NYPD FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force
persons.role: Law enforcement officer requesting travel approval
persons.context: The primary author requesting approval for travel to Massachusetts to arrest a target in the Epstein investigation. Provides expense breakdowns for the trip.

persons.name: SSA- Crimes Against Children and Human Trafficking Unit FBIHQ/CID/VCS
persons.role: FBI Supervisory Special Agent approving travel
persons.context: Approves the travel request and provides the operational travel EAN (Expense Account Number) 564339.1 for the mission.

connections.person1: Detective NYPD FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force
connections.description: Detective submits a travel request for operational approval to MI, who is likely a supervisor.

connections.person1: Detective NYPD FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force
connections.person2: SSA- Crimes Against Children and Human Trafficking Unit FBIHQ/CID/VCS
connections.description: The SSA approves the detective's travel request and provides funding authorization.

events.title: Travel to Massachusetts for arrest operation
events.description: A four-person law enforcement team (the detective, another officer, and two supervisors) travels to Massachusetts to arrest a target in the Epstein investigation, with plans to possibly escort the target back to New York.

Detective NYPD FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force

keyFacts: In late June/early July 2020, an active operation was underway to arrest a target in the Epstein investigation, believed to be located in Massachusetts.
The operation involved a four-person team from an NYPD/FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force, including two supervisors.
The team planned to drive, make the arrest, and possibly escort the target back to New York.
Travel was approved using the FBI's Crimes Against Children and Human Trafficking Unit operational funds (EAN 564339.1).
The email chain shows procedural coordination and expense management for a sensitive law enforcement operation years after Epstein's death.
